docs.text: for a film touted as exploring relationships and black sexuality , trois is surprisingly tame .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: despite it's lurid subject matter and it's passing nod to fatal attraction , it moves along with flat , uninspired dialogue as it sets up a surprising climax that tries mightily to overthrow the considerable dead weight of the rest of the film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: freshly moved to atlanta , jermaine ( dourdan ) and his wife , jasmine ( moore ) , have the trappings of a perfect life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they have a beautiful house in suburbia .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jermaine is a lawyer on the fast track at his firm .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jasmine is his supportive wife , who is finishing up her college degree .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in an opening montage via a home video of the pair , we see the unremarkable story of their marriage and early marital triumphs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is a couple that has it all .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: into this eden slithers the lure of lust .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: despite his outward appearance , jermaine reveals himself as selfish and covetous of his wife more as a possession than a person .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a glimmer of his true nature peeks out during an early sex scene with his wife as he goes about his business , oblivious to jasmine's concerns .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we also find that he has been relentlessly asking jasmine to participate in a menage- a-trois , much to jasmine's dismay .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as jermaine puts it , " don't you want to be sexually free ? "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jermaine shares his desire with co-worker terrence ( smith ) , who obligingly sets jermaine up with a woman who might be interested in just such an encounter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the woman , jade ( palmer ) is a direct counterpoint to jasmine .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jade , at one point was a college student , too .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unlike jasmine , she found herself pregnant , dropped out of school and now struggles to make ends meet .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to further reinforce their differences , it's revealed that jade is involved in a custody battle over her son .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: inevitably , through liquor and a touch of duplicity on jermaine's part , the forbidden act is consummated .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the aftermath of the encounter sidesteps into fatal attraction territory as acts of violence are perpetrated upon jermaine's property with the hint that the violence may escalate .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: by this point , trois shows itself to be a soap opera without the requisite melodrama : a fatal attraction without the social significance .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the exploration of relationships is strictly superficial and stereotypical .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jermaine comes off as insincere , sexually driven and selfish .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jasmine is bland and subservient .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jade comes off a bit sympathetically , but that is negated by her moral bankruptcy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: yet another tale of a sexually aggressive " dog " of a man who imposes his will upon his accommodating , innocent mate .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the last 10 minutes will undoubtly throw you a curve , but by this point , will you even care ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if the rest of the movie was as dynamic as the ending , perhaps there could have been some freshness to it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as it stands , trois is pretty standard fare .
docs.label: negative
